hi and welcome you listening to the x-22
report my name is Dave and this is
episode 1235 a and today's date is March
22nd 2017 and the title of the episode
is the corporate media flip flops on the
economy retail apocalypses here crisis
around the corner let's get into the
economic collapse financial news now
yesterday we talked about the market and
it was down 200 points today it was down
it was up a little bit it looks like it
closed down and we talked about the
chaos in the market and when we talked
about chaos and we talked about the
volatility of the market and how things
are reversing now it doesn't mean the
markets going to come down tomorrow
we're going to see fluctuations in the
market moving forward yes are we gonna
have days up we're gonna also have days
that are down which shows us that things
are rapidly deteriorating very quickly
because in the past we just saw the
market rise market rise market rise and
that was it what we're seeing now is
that these huge investors these
individuals these institutional
investors the insiders they are dumping
their stock right now they want retail
investors to pick up the slack here
they're getting out of the markets and
we can see right now the only way to
pump up the markets is with free money
from the Fed using the high-frequency
traders to keep the trading going and
what we're seeing is a complete
breakdown and as we move forward we're
going to see this chaos continue and
we're already seeing the entire system
and when we look at the entire system
we're looking at many different economic
indicators we're looking at housing
we're looking at GDP we're looking at
retail we're looking at unemployment
we're looking at corporate defaults
we're looking at the auto loan industry
we're looking at manufacturing we're
looking at many different areas and one
thing that's been in focus for quite a
while
we've been tracking how retail has been
contracting and I remember first
reporting about this and people were
laughing and saying that's ridiculous
retail is not contracting people aren't
losing jobs and as we move forward it
just got worse and worse the same thing
with housing where in the beginning
people like oh it's perfectly fine in my
area and yes they're still going to be
areas where
still fine but what happens is each area
gets hit at different time periods and
people have been emailing me like crazy
from all over the country saying that
things are dramatically changing in the
real estate market but in retail we can
see right now that this is a complete
disaster I mean Sears right now which we
know they're not going to be able to
continue any longer and we're seeing
that many stores are starting to close
down but what's more interesting is that
the corporate media they are starting to
realize and they're starting to report
on how the retail industry is not doing
well yes they did it in the past but
they used to say well everything is
moving to online that's what explains it
oh the weather is bad remember all these
things it was snowing it was rainy it
was foggy it was sunny and they used all
these excuses going forward why we said
no it's because people are losing jobs
continually they don't have the extra
funds to go out and purchase the goods
and we looked at online and online
didn't take up the slack so all what
they were saying was completely fake
phony and false now the corporate media
is out there saying that the retail
apocalypse has officially descended on
America really well remember what I said
many many reports ago the corporate
media is going to let us know when the
economy coming from the deep state
coming from the central bank when the
economy is going to start breaking down
they're gonna show that the economy is
not doing as well as they were all
saying and they've already started this
now they've come out with this
information that all of a sudden things
aren't going as well and they're saying
that thousands of mall based stores
while they're shutting down in what's
fast becoming one of the biggest waves
of retail closures in decades they're
saying more than 3,500 stores are
expected to close in the next couple of
months stores like JCPenney Macy's Sears
Kmart and many others we also have
middle of the mall chains like Crocs
BCBG Abercrombie Fitch and guess these
were these stores are going to be
closing down and what they're saying is

in early 2017 are as follows
Kahless a thousand stores RadioShack 550
to the limited 250 stores family
christian 240 stores what sealed 171 BB
a hundred and seventy crocks 160
JCPenney 138 BCBG 120 American Apparel
110 and it goes on and on and what we're

closing now think about it if all these

people going to get work where do they
go now it doesn't really affect the

people who work in part time and it
varies from state to state because it
all depends on how many hours they work
and how many what their dollar amount is
that they're earning and remember how
the whole thing works as they lose their
jobs they're considered part-time if
that getting those hours and not getting
the dollar amount they're not counted
they're not eligible for unemployment
insurance but when they got the job they
were counted as a full-time job so you
can see how this whole thing works you
can see how the numbers are skewed
manipulated and this is what we're
seeing right now we're gonna see
thousands and thousands of people
they're gonna be laid off
now remember when all these stores
closed how do they count the sales the

we have 500 stores from this place the
sales just come to a screeching halt
that go down to zero
no they extrapolated out over the year
and they slowly remove the sales from

it's not real its fake so we're seeing

do they're starting to prove that the

we're not even talking about the next
half of 27
because you know there's gonna be more

auto industry well this is a complete

of auto dealers
well they reported an anomaly dropping
used vehicle prices in February which
occurred only for the second time in the
past twenty years it was a big one it's
used car guides seasonally adjusted used
vehicle price index plunged three point
eight percent from January by far the
worst recorded for any month since
November of 2008 and that was because of
a recession which tumbled by five point
six percent which were pretty darn close
and we're supposed to be in this
incredible recovery which were not now
the index has now dropped eight months
in a row and hit the lowest level since
September of 2010 the index the index is
down eight percent year-over-year and
down thirteen percent from its peak in
2014 and the price the price decline
spanned all segments and we look at the
luxury car market we see that it has
come down negative three point one
percent subcompact car negative two
point one percent large SUV negative one
point nine percent and so on and so on
and we are seeing a surge in new vehicle
incentive spending now the question is
why are we seeing this well because
automakers right now they're drowning in
unsold inventories on dealer lots and
they are desperate to move these
vehicles off the lot so they're
continually getting more and more
incentives and we've seen this back in
2008 now in the housing industry well
things are not going well things are
actually getting worse right now and as
we know the Fed has raised interest
rates by twenty another 25 basis points
and we can see the end of 2015 as soon
as a Trump was elected they raise rates
now they raise rates once again and we
can see that rates for mortgages they're
continually moving up applications are
going down and we see existing home
sales slid in February 3.7 percent of
course they expected only a two point
0% fall but it was a lot more than that
existing condominium and co-op sales
well they descended by 9.2 percent and
finally judging by the collapse in

unless there's all-cash buyers we're

they are coming down we're seeing houses
on the market longer and longer just go

lowering their prices traffic is not
what it used to be and this is what
happened back in 2008 and what we're
looking at right now and the corporate

they use the word retail apocalypse I
mean that's something that I would use
which I haven't another report but other

since Trump is an office they've already

Yellen was out there telling us that
she's very disappointed in the economy
the economy wasn't as strong as she

decided to raise interest rates during
Obama's term she told us that the

even lower at that point in time and she
didn't want to raise interest rates and
if you really look at it right after

and we can see retail is contracting and
they're thinking about raising the

things are going to rapidly change right

gonna say this is really having a toy
it's really taking a toll on the economy
and they're gonna continually do this
I'm gonna play it up just like they

not true
just like they played up the hacking of

the Fed needs to redirect all eyes to

and Trump knows that this cannot be

well the
